question: In how many categories are the parliamentary standing committees classified?
explanation: The parliamentary standing committees are classified on the basis of the nature of functions performed by them. Presently they are classified in six categories: Financial Committees, Departmental Standing Committees, Committees to Inquire, Committees to Scrutinise and Control, Committees Relating to the Day-to-Day Business of the House and House-Keeping Committees or Service Committees.
